data.title: Moat (Oracle Data Cloud)
data.subtitle: Full Stack Developer
data.description:
• Built an end-to-end system for User Access involving Database design, Data migration, API design, Frontend code, UX, and Tests.
  • Took complete full-stack ownership of a client-facing feature; Improved the turn-around time by adding bash and python automation and documentation.
  • Analyzed, reported and cleaned up malformed data using SQL scripts
  • Setup a Docker dev environment, setup a private npm server and wrote githooks.
  • Built re-usable frontend components and deployed to npm
  • Setup the backbone for our application's server with modular Services, Routers and URL parsing.

data.title: Moat (Intern)
data.subtitle: JavaScript Developer
data.description: <li>Integrated a new client into Moat's product, using JavaScript.<li>Contributed to the Moat Android and iOS SDK.

data.title: InMobi
data.subtitle: Frontend Developer
data.description: <li>Created new Mobile Ad experiences using JavaScript, HTML and CSS.<li>Released an Open Source JS Library to measure element viewability.<li>Developed an automation tool using Grunt and Shell scripts.<li>Worked on experimental ad formats using Mraid APIs.

data.title: Teaching Experience
data.subtitle: Workshops, Online Courses
data.description:
• Conducted a 2 hour-workshop at NYU titled Frontend Mini Bootcamp. Read more here.
  • Conducted a 2 hour workshop at NYU on Natural Language Processing. Read more here.
  • Created an Online Course on HTML and CSS.

data.title: ShareQuick
data.subtitle: Creator, Developer
data.description: Launched a Chrome Extension and Android app to send content from your desktop browser to your phone. Over 5000 downloads. Selected for FbStart - Facebook's early stage mobile startup program. Winner Sequoia Hack 2015 (Bangalore)

data.title: Resume Maker
data.subtitle: React, Redux App
data.description: Developed for the Frontend Web-Dev workshop I conducted at NYU. This resume was made with it!

data.title: Cornell University
data.subtitle: M.Eng Computer Science, GPA 3.5
data.description: OS, NLP, Databases, ML, Crowdsourcing, Language and Information, Visual Analytics for the Web and Entrepreneurship.
